    • Method Detail

      • open

        public void open(java.lang.String comPort)
          throws java.lang.Exception
        Open the reader at the Com Port. The COM port may be found by opening the Device Manager in Windows.
        Parameters:
        comPort - com port string, for example "COM31", etc.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • close

        public void close()
        Closes the com port, if opened.

      • toHex

        public java.lang.String toHex(byte[] data)
        Convert data into hex.
        Parameters:
        data - data as byte array.
        Returns:
        hex string.

      • scan

        public byte[] scan(int retries)
            throws java.lang.Exception
        Scans for a card. If found, returns it's UID.
        Parameters:
        retries - number of tries to scan for card.
        Returns:
        the UID of the card.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • keys

        public void keys(byte[] keyA,
                 byte[] keyB)
          throws java.lang.Exception
        Set keys for memory access. For a new card, use null for both the keys. Mifare cards have two type of keys.
        Parameters:
        keyA - a key, defined by the card manufacturer. For Mifare 1K, this is 6 byte.
        keyB - a key, defined by the card manufacturer. For Mifare 1K, this is 6 byte.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • read

        public byte[] read(int block,
                   boolean keyB)
            throws java.lang.Exception
        Reads a block. If keyB is to be used instead of keyA, provide true.
        Parameters:
        block - block number or page number.
        keyB - which key to use indicator.
        Returns:
        array of read bytes.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • write

        public boolean write(int block,
                     byte[] data,
                     boolean keyB)
              throws java.lang.Exception
        Writes data to a block. The data array must equal the size of the block. For Ultralight data size is 4 bytes. For Mifare, data size is 16 bytes.
        Parameters:
        block - block or page index.
        data - data to be written. The array size must equal the block size.
        keyB - which key to use indicator.
        Returns:
        if written successfully.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • name

        public java.lang.String name()
        Returns name of the Card. The card names are in the enum CardType.
        Returns:
        card name.

      • type

        public jence.jni.J4210N.CardType type()
        Card type, corresponds to one of the entry in CardType enum.
        Returns:
        CardType enum entry.

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Parameters:
        args -
